sense.name: an enclosed passageway connected to other rooms
sense.examples: They stood in the vestibule of the main lobby, waiting for a cab. The entrance of the luxury railcar had a private vestibule. We were led through a vestibule into a narrow hallway to the desk of the hotel clerk.

sense.name: an anatomical cavity in the body
sense.examples: The child had an infection of the vestibule of the inner ear. The vestibule of the left ventricle of her heart had a malformation.
